column5: I bought a new boat this spring and upgraded my electronics to a Humminbird 898c SI.I thought this would be a great search tool to find new humps,reefs,rock piles and drop offs.Has anybody been using it up there?If so how did it work out?Thanks.Bill
Our boat will be using it for the first time this year as well. Should be interesting to see what's down there. In Lac Seul I imagine you will see a lot of stumps and walleyes.
Im going to be fishing Lac Seul for the first time this year and thinking about picking up a DI. How much did it help you guys?

I don't go to Lac Seul but I started taking my side imaging as a portable unit a couple of years ago on our train-in. It's fantastic, I found structure I didn't know was there because we didn't go directly over it in previous years and it is easier to find structure you already know about and you get a better idea of the layout.

Ypou can also use lower Humminbird units that are dual and quadBeam Plus capable. 700 series with ci. You may wish to compare prices of this add-on. A unit with built in di/si may be less $$$$. Good luck.

I was surprised how Down imaging helped to clearly identify structure.Side Imaging help me/lead me to see structure I had never found before.Walleye fishing just got more fun.billius aka btmbncr aka Backtroller Billy!!
